result.execSummary:
All charges against Logan Sheppard in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Logan Sheppard is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan Sheppard

records.addlTxt: case dismissed

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Logan Sheppard in court.  Attorney Corey Chirafisi in court for Logan Sheppard.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Lennon advises that an offer was given to the defense today and they would like to accept it. However, the deal requires that the DE complete treatment upfront. If that occurs the State will dismiss this case. Court will set a status conference for 60 days out.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant's First Motion in Limine
Parties have not reached an agreement and request trial dates. Court issues trial dates and gives notice in hand to the DE.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jennifer S except only through OurFamilyWizard and only for child-related issues. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jack L. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 17 

Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:18 AM Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner in court on behalf of defendant.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
